questions.question: What are the three main parts of an essay?

questions.question: The first sentence of a body paragraph, which states its main idea, is called the...

questions.question: An essay should be focused on...

questions.question: What should the conclusion of an essay do?

questions.question: Sentences in a paragraph should be...

questions.question: Which of these is a good transition word to start a second body paragraph?

questions.question: An essay that tells a personal story is a ______ essay.

questions.question: An essay that describes a person, place, or thing is a ______ essay.

questions.question: A statement sentence in an essay should end with a...

questions.question: The body paragraphs are located between the introduction and the...
questions.correct_answer: Conclusion

questions.question: What is the purpose of giving examples in a body paragraph?
questions.correct_answer: To support the topic sentence

questions.question: Which of these is a good brainstorming technique?
questions.correct_answer: Making a list of ideas

questions.question: What is the very first paragraph of an essay called?

questions.question: The thesis statement is usually one...
questions.correct_answer: sentence

questions.question: An essay should be organized...
questions.correct_answer: logically

questions.question: Which is the correct order?

questions.question: An essay that tries to convince you of something is called a ______ essay.

questions.question: An essay that explains or informs about a topic is a ______ essay.
questions.correct_answer: Expository

questions.question: The final step after writing an essay is to...

questions.question: What is the purpose of an outline?

questions.question: Each body paragraph should focus on ______ main idea.

questions.question: What does a descriptive essay do?
questions.correct_answer: Paints a picture with words

questions.question: The details in a body paragraph should be ______ to the topic sentence.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a title?

questions.question: Which of these is a good topic for a narrative essay?

questions.question: Which of these is a good topic for a persuasive essay?

questions.question: The conclusion should ______ the thesis statement.

questions.question: What is the most important sentence in the whole essay?
options: The first sentence of the body
The last sentence of the conclusion

questions.question: What is 'plagiarism'?

questions.question: A standard school essay usually has how many paragraphs?
questions.correct_answer: Five (Intro, 3 Body, Conclusion)

questions.question: A 'hook' is a sentence used to...
questions.correct_answer: catch the reader's attention

questions.question: Supporting sentences in a body paragraph should provide...
questions.correct_answer: details, examples, or explanations

questions.question: What should be the tone of a formal essay?
questions.correct_answer: Objective and respectful

questions.question: What is the main goal of an expository essay?
questions.correct_answer: To explain or inform

questions.question: What does it mean to 'stay on topic'?

To make sure all your points relate to the main idea
To change the subject in every paragraph

questions.question: The word 'essay' comes from a French word meaning...
questions.correct_answer: to try or attempt

questions.question: Where should the title of the essay be placed?
options: In the middle of the first paragraph
questions.correct_answer: At the top, centered

questions.question: Using your five senses (sight, sound, smell, taste, touch) is most important in which type of essay?
questions.correct_answer: Descriptive

questions.question: What is the purpose of the body of an essay?
options: To develop and support the main idea
questions.correct_answer: To develop and support the main idea

questions.question: Before submitting your essay, you should check for...
questions.correct_answer: All of the above

questions.question: A strong essay needs a strong...
questions.correct_answer: All of the above

questions.question: What is the very last step of the writing process?
questions.correct_answer: Publishing or submitting

questions.question: Transition words help to...
questions.correct_answer: connect ideas smoothly

questions.question: A strong thesis statement should be...
questions.correct_answer: a specific and arguable claim

questions.question: What is the main difference between a narrative and a descriptive essay?
options: A narrative explains, while a descriptive tells a story.
A narrative tells a story with a plot, while a descriptive paints a picture with sensory details.
A narrative argues a point, while a descriptive explains.
questions.correct_answer: A narrative tells a story with a plot, while a descriptive paints a picture with sensory details.

questions.question: What is the purpose of providing evidence in a persuasive essay?
options: To support your claims and make them more convincing
questions.correct_answer: To support your claims and make them more convincing

questions.question: Which of these is the best example of a 'hook' for an essay about pollution?
options: Pollution is a big problem in the world.
Every day, thousands of tons of plastic are dumped into our oceans, creating a deadly trap for marine life.
I will now tell you about pollution.
questions.correct_answer: Every day, thousands of tons of plastic are dumped into our oceans, creating a deadly trap for marine life.

questions.question: What does it mean to 'paraphrase' a source?
options: To copy it word for word
To use only a small part of it
To restate the main idea in your own words
questions.correct_answer: To restate the main idea in your own words

questions.question: The structure of a typical body paragraph is: Topic Sentence, ______, and Concluding Sentence.
questions.correct_answer: Supporting Sentences

questions.question: In a compare and contrast essay, what is the main goal?
options: To describe one subject in detail
To tell a story about two subjects
To show the similarities and differences between two subjects
To argue that one subject is better than the other
questions.correct_answer: To show the similarities and differences between two subjects

questions.question: What is a 'prompt' in essay writing?
options: The final copy of the essay
The question or statement you have to write about
questions.correct_answer: The question or statement you have to write about

questions.question: The term 'coherence' in an essay means that...
options: the ideas are logically connected and easy to follow
the essay has a good title
questions.correct_answer: the ideas are logically connected and easy to follow

questions.question: A 'first draft' of an essay is...
options: the first attempt at writing the essay, which will be revised later
questions.correct_answer: the first attempt at writing the essay, which will be revised later

questions.question: Which type of essay would be most likely to use chronological order (time order)?
questions.correct_answer: Narrative

options: Revising is about big picture issues like ideas and organization, while proofreading is about smaller errors like spelling.
Revising is checking spelling, while proofreading is about ideas.
Revising is the first step, and proofreading is the second step.
questions.correct_answer: Revising is about big picture issues like ideas and organization, while proofreading is about smaller errors like spelling.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a strong thesis statement?
options: School uniforms should be mandatory to promote equality.
This essay will discuss the pros and cons of school uniforms.
Banning junk food in schools is essential for student health.
Social media has a negative impact on the mental health of teenagers.
questions.correct_answer: This essay will discuss the pros and cons of school uniforms.

questions.question: A concluding paragraph should not just summarize, but also provide...
options: a sense of closure or a final thought
a hook for the next essay
questions.correct_answer: a sense of closure or a final thought

questions.question: What is the purpose of a 'topic sentence'?
options: To introduce the main idea of a specific body paragraph
To hook the reader at the beginning
To list all the sources used
questions.correct_answer: To introduce the main idea of a specific body paragraph

questions.question: What is 'audience' in the context of writing?
options: The person who will be reading the essay
The main character in the essay
questions.correct_answer: The person who will be reading the essay

questions.question: A mind map is a tool used for...
questions.correct_answer: brainstorming and organizing ideas

questions.question: In a persuasive essay, your 'claim' is your...
questions.correct_answer: main argument or position

questions.question: Using statistics or quotes from experts is a way to provide ______ for your arguments.
questions.correct_answer: evidence

questions.question: An expository essay that explains how to do something is called a ______ essay.
questions.correct_answer: process

questions.question: Why is it important to understand the essay prompt before you start writing?
options: To make sure you answer the question that is being asked
questions.correct_answer: To make sure you answer the question that is being asked

questions.question: Which of these helps to improve the flow between paragraphs?
options: Using a new topic for each paragraph
Ending each paragraph with a question
questions.correct_answer: Using transition sentences

questions.question: What is the difference between a fact and an opinion?
options: A fact can be proven, while an opinion is a personal belief.
A fact is a personal belief, while an opinion can be proven.
A fact is always long, and an opinion is always short.
questions.correct_answer: A fact can be proven, while an opinion is a personal belief.

questions.question: A persuasive essay should appeal to the reader's logic and...
questions.correct_answer: emotions

questions.question: The 'tone' of an essay refers to the...
questions.correct_answer: author's attitude toward the subject

questions.question: Which of these would be a good supporting detail for the topic sentence 'Dogs are loyal pets'?
options: Many stories exist of dogs who have saved their owners' lives.
Dogs need to be walked every day.
Some dogs can be very big.
questions.correct_answer: Many stories exist of dogs who have saved their owners' lives.

questions.question: In the five-paragraph essay model, how many main points are typically developed in the body?
questions.correct_answer: Three

questions.question: What does it mean to 'cite' a source?
options: To give credit to the original author of the information you used
questions.correct_answer: To give credit to the original author of the information you used

questions.question: A chronological order in an essay arranges information according to...
questions.correct_answer: time sequence

questions.question: A 'thesis map' is part of a thesis statement that...
options: gives a map of a place
lists the main points that will be covered in the body paragraphs
questions.correct_answer: lists the main points that will be covered in the body paragraphs

questions.question: An expository essay that examines the causes and effects of an event is called a ______ essay.
questions.correct_answer: Cause and Effect

questions.question: What is the purpose of a concluding sentence in a body paragraph?
options: To summarize the paragraph and transition to the next
questions.correct_answer: To summarize the paragraph and transition to the next

questions.question: When you revise your essay, you should check for...
options: clarity, organization, and development of ideas
questions.correct_answer: clarity, organization, and development of ideas

questions.question: Using a direct quote from an expert is a good way to provide...
questions.correct_answer: evidence

options: All its parts work together to support the thesis.
It contains irrelevant ideas that do not support the thesis.

questions.question: The introduction paragraph should move from...
options: specific details to a general idea
general ideas to a specific thesis statement
questions.correct_answer: general ideas to a specific thesis statement

questions.question: A cause and effect essay explains...
options: the reasons for an event and its results
questions.correct_answer: the reasons for an event and its results

questions.question: Why is it important to use your own words when writing an essay?
options: To avoid plagiarism and show your understanding
To make the essay harder to read
questions.correct_answer: To avoid plagiarism and show your understanding

questions.question: A good essay writer always considers their ______ before writing.
questions.correct_answer: purpose and audience

questions.question: A 'working thesis' is...
options: an initial idea for a thesis that you can revise as you write
questions.correct_answer: an initial idea for a thesis that you can revise as you write

questions.question: An argumentative essay is another name for a/an ______ essay.
questions.correct_answer: persuasive

questions.question: What is wrong with a thesis statement like 'Pollution is bad'?
options: It is a fact, not an arguable claim.
questions.correct_answer: It is a fact, not an arguable claim.

questions.question: The conclusion paragraph should move from...
options: general ideas to a specific point
a specific summary to a broader final thought
questions.correct_answer: a specific summary to a broader final thought

questions.question: What does it mean for an essay to have a 'logical flow'?
options: The ideas are presented in a random order.
The ideas are connected and progress in a way that makes sense.
The essay has many spelling mistakes.
questions.correct_answer: The ideas are connected and progress in a way that makes sense.

questions.question: In a persuasive essay, what is 'evidence'?
options: Facts, statistics, and examples that support your claim
questions.correct_answer: Facts, statistics, and examples that support your claim

questions.question: Which of these is a good transition phrase to show contrast?
questions.correct_answer: On the other hand

questions.question: Which of these is a good transition phrase to show a result?
questions.correct_answer: As a result

questions.question: An 'anecdote' is a...
questions.correct_answer: short, personal story

questions.question: An essay with a 'block method' structure is likely a ______ essay.

questions.question: The final sentence of the conclusion should...
options: leave the reader with a strong final impression
questions.correct_answer: leave the reader with a strong final impression

questions.question: What is the primary function of a counter-argument in a persuasive essay?
options: To show that you have considered opposing viewpoints and can refute them
To fill up space in the essay
questions.correct_answer: To show that you have considered opposing viewpoints and can refute them

questions.question: The term 'diction' in essay writing refers to the...
questions.correct_answer: author's choice of words

questions.question: The arrangement of words and phrases to create well-formed sentences is known as...
questions.correct_answer: Syntax

questions.question: A logical fallacy is a/an...
options: flaw in reasoning that weakens an argument
good way to persuade the reader
questions.correct_answer: flaw in reasoning that weakens an argument

questions.question: The 'Ad Hominem' fallacy is an error where the writer...
options: attacks the person making the argument instead of the argument itself
assumes that because one event followed another, the first event caused the second
uses an emotional appeal instead of a logical one
questions.correct_answer: attacks the person making the argument instead of the argument itself

questions.question: What is a 'rebuttal' in an argumentative essay?
options: The main claim of the essay
The response that disproves an opposing argument
questions.correct_answer: The response that disproves an opposing argument

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a 'call to action' in the conclusion of a persuasive essay?
options: To ask the reader a question
To urge the reader to do something in response to the argument
To state the thesis for the first time

questions.correct_answer: unfocused and superficial

uses a personal story as evidence
repeats their claim over and over
questions.correct_answer: misrepresents an opponent's argument to make it easier to attack

questions.question: Using varied sentence structures in an essay helps to...
options: make the writing more engaging and sophisticated
ensure all sentences are the same length
questions.correct_answer: make the writing more engaging and sophisticated

questions.question: An 'analytical' essay aims to...
options: break down a text or an issue into its parts and examine them
persuade the reader to take action

questions.question: What is the key difference between a summary and a paraphrase?
options: A summary is longer than the original; a paraphrase is shorter.
A summary captures the main points concisely; a paraphrase restates the content in detail but in your own words.
A summary uses quotes; a paraphrase does not.

questions.question: A 'rhetorical question' used as a hook is effective because it...
options: gives the reader the answer immediately
engages the reader and makes them think about the topic
is a requirement for all essays
questions.correct_answer: engages the reader and makes them think about the topic

questions.question: The 'point-by-point' method is a structure used in which type of essay?

questions.question: A thesis-driven essay means that...
options: the thesis is only mentioned in the conclusion
the entire essay is structured to support and prove the thesis statement
the essay has no main point
the essay tells a personal story
questions.correct_answer: the entire essay is structured to support and prove the thesis statement

questions.question: What is the problem with a 'circular reasoning' fallacy?
options: The argument assumes the claim is true without providing any real evidence.
The argument uses an emotional appeal.
questions.correct_answer: The argument assumes the claim is true without providing any real evidence.

questions.question: The use of formal academic language is known as...
questions.correct_answer: Academic register

questions.question: The concluding paragraph can effectively end by...
options: offering a solution or suggesting future possibilities
restating the introduction word for word
questions.correct_answer: offering a solution or suggesting future possibilities

questions.question: A 'concession' in an argumentative essay is when you...
options: acknowledge a valid point from the opposing view
agree completely with the opposing view
questions.correct_answer: acknowledge a valid point from the opposing view

questions.question: What is the primary function of a transition sentence between two body paragraphs?
options: To link the idea of the first paragraph to the idea of the second
questions.correct_answer: To link the idea of the first paragraph to the idea of the second

questions.question: The fallacy of 'False Dichotomy' or 'Either/Or' occurs when...
options: an argument presents only two options when more exist
an argument is based on emotion

questions.question: In academic writing, using the first-person ('I believe...') is often discouraged in favor of a more...
questions.correct_answer: objective and impersonal tone

questions.question: What is the purpose of analyzing the essay prompt for keywords?
options: To identify words you don't know
To understand the specific task and constraints of the assignment
To find words to use in your essay
questions.correct_answer: To understand the specific task and constraints of the assignment

questions.question: A 'synthesis' essay requires the writer to...
options: combine information from multiple sources to create a new, coherent argument
questions.correct_answer: combine information from multiple sources to create a new, coherent argument

questions.question: What is the effect of using sophisticated diction in an essay?
options: It always makes the essay better.
It can enhance the essay's tone and precision if used correctly.
It makes the essay harder to read and is always a bad idea.
It is a form of plagiarism.
questions.correct_answer: It can enhance the essay's tone and precision if used correctly.

questions.question: The 'Slippery Slope' fallacy argues that...
options: one small action will inevitably lead to a chain of negative events
an expert's opinion is always right
an idea is good because it is popular
questions.correct_answer: one small action will inevitably lead to a chain of negative events

questions.question: Why is it important to have a clear organizational structure in an essay?
options: It helps the reader follow the argument logically.
It allows you to add irrelevant information.
It makes the essay look visually appealing.
questions.correct_answer: It helps the reader follow the argument logically.

questions.question: A 'critical' essay does not simply summarize a text, but...
options: agrees with everything in the text
evaluates and analyzes the text's strengths and weaknesses
rewrites the text in a better way
questions.correct_answer: evaluates and analyzes the text's strengths and weaknesses

questions.question: Using a 'block quote' is appropriate when...
options: you want to paraphrase an idea
the quote is long (usually more than four lines) and you want it to stand out
you don't know how to cite
questions.correct_answer: the quote is long (usually more than four lines) and you want it to stand out

questions.question: The 'Bandwagon Appeal' fallacy tries to persuade the reader by arguing that...
options: an idea is true because an expert said so
an idea is true because it is popular
an idea is wrong because it is old
an idea is wrong because it is unpopular
questions.correct_answer: an idea is true because it is popular

questions.question: What is the purpose of a 'literature review' section in a research essay?
options: To summarize and synthesize existing research on a topic
To state your own opinion without evidence
questions.correct_answer: To summarize and synthesize existing research on a topic

questions.question: Varying the syntax in your writing means you should...
options: use a mix of different sentence lengths and structures
questions.correct_answer: use a mix of different sentence lengths and structures

questions.question: What does it mean for evidence to be 'credible'?
options: It is from a personal blog.
It is from a trustworthy and authoritative source.
questions.correct_answer: It is from a trustworthy and authoritative source.

questions.question: The 'Hasty Generalization' fallacy is when a conclusion is drawn from...
questions.correct_answer: insufficient or biased evidence

questions.question: An 'explication' is a type of analytical essay that involves...
options: a broad summary of a long work
a close reading and detailed analysis of a short passage or poem
a personal story related to the work
a comparison of two different works
questions.correct_answer: a close reading and detailed analysis of a short passage or poem

questions.question: A strong concluding sentence of a body paragraph should not just summarize, but also...
options: link back to the thesis statement
questions.correct_answer: link back to the thesis statement

questions.question: What is the purpose of using an 'analogy' in an essay?
options: To make a simple concept more complex
To explain a complex or unfamiliar idea by comparing it to a simpler, more familiar one
questions.correct_answer: To explain a complex or unfamiliar idea by comparing it to a simpler, more familiar one

questions.question: What is the primary danger of using abstract language (e.g., 'freedom', 'love') without providing concrete examples?
options: It makes the essay too short.
The meaning can become vague and unclear to the reader.
It makes the essay too emotional.
questions.correct_answer: The meaning can become vague and unclear to the reader.

questions.question: The 'Red Herring' fallacy is an attempt to...
options: support an argument with strong evidence
distract the audience by introducing an irrelevant topic
questions.correct_answer: distract the audience by introducing an irrelevant topic

questions.question: A 'nuanced' argument in an essay is one that...
options: recognizes the complexity of an issue and avoids oversimplification
questions.correct_answer: recognizes the complexity of an issue and avoids oversimplification

questions.question: In academic writing, what is the role of the 'abstract'?
options: It is the main body of the essay.
It is a short summary of the entire paper, including its purpose, methods, results, and conclusion.
It is the list of sources.
questions.correct_answer: It is a short summary of the entire paper, including its purpose, methods, results, and conclusion.

questions.question: What is the 'Appeal to Authority' fallacy?
options: Using a credible and relevant expert to support a claim.
Claiming something is true because an unqualified or biased person said it is.
Using logic to support a claim.
questions.correct_answer: Claiming something is true because an unqualified or biased person said it is.

questions.question: What is the function of a 'topic proposal' in the writing process?
options: It is the final draft of the essay.
It is a preliminary plan outlining the topic, thesis, and potential sources for an essay.
It is the works cited page.
It is a summary of a completed essay.
questions.correct_answer: It is a preliminary plan outlining the topic, thesis, and potential sources for an essay.

questions.question: The 'Post Hoc Ergo Propter Hoc' fallacy is the error of assuming that...
options: if two things are popular, they must be good
because one event followed another, the first event caused the second
an argument is wrong because the person saying it is bad
an argument is right because many people believe it
questions.correct_answer: because one event followed another, the first event caused the second

questions.question: What does it mean for an essay to have 'voice'?
options: The essay is written in a robotic, impersonal style.
The essay reflects the writer's unique personality and style.
The essay is read out loud.
The essay has many spelling mistakes.
questions.correct_answer: The essay reflects the writer's unique personality and style.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a 'definition' essay?
options: To provide a detailed and nuanced explanation of a term or concept
questions.correct_answer: To provide a detailed and nuanced explanation of a term or concept

questions.question: What is 'parallel structure' in a sentence?
options: Using the same grammatical form for items in a list or series.
questions.correct_answer: Using the same grammatical form for items in a list or series.

questions.question: An effective essay conclusion might end with a provocative question, a warning, or...
options: an apology for the essay's weaknesses
questions.correct_answer: a look to the future

questions.question: What is the 'pathos' appeal in a persuasive essay?
options: An appeal to the writer's credibility (ethos)
An appeal to the reader's emotions
questions.correct_answer: An appeal to the reader's emotions

questions.question: A 'holistic' approach to revising an essay means...
options: looking at the essay as a whole to see if all parts work together effectively
questions.correct_answer: looking at the essay as a whole to see if all parts work together effectively
